definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The work's chant maybe a rapid one.
sentences.chinese: 这也许是比较急促的号子。

sentences.english: Wyatt shows up at the police station and seesMahone in the cell.
sentences.chinese: 怀亚特在警察局出现，发现了马宏被关在号子里。

sentences.english: The blues grew out of African spirituals and work songs.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯乐成长自非洲人的精神和劳动号子中。

sentences.english: The blues comes from African songs that people used to sing when they worked and during festivals.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯来源于非洲的劳动号子和节庆歌唱。

sentences.english: Mentions the boatman worker's chant, our young friend possibly not too understood.
sentences.chinese: 说起船工号子，我们年轻的朋友可能不太了解。

sentences.english: Southern Gansu, and eastern Gansu labor chant and songs Jia Miao, unique style.
sentences.chinese: 甘肃陇南和陇东的劳动号子，词曲佳妙，风格独特。

sentences.english: A brokerage yuppie no longer, Wu Hsin-hui now works happily in insurance.
sentences.chinese: 不做号子英雄，吴心慧是个快乐的保险业务员。

sentences.english: Sure, some old buddies of mine did time there once.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我的一些老朋友在那地方蹲过号子。

definition: to scull (with a single oar, usually mounted on the stern of the boat)
flat stone with ropes attached, used to ram the ground
to shout/to bawl/to yell (to urge on an animal)/to hawk (one's wares)/to denounce loudly/to shout slogans
